get.description:
Returns vehicle checks for the vehicle. If vehicleName is specified, then returns all vehicle checks for that vehicle in the specified period. If personName is specified, then returns all vehicle checks completed by that driver in the specified period. If groupName is specified, returns all vehicle checks for all vehicles in the specified group in the specified period.
At least one of the parameters: personName, groupName, or vehicleName must be specified.

parameters.name: dateTimeFrom
parameters.description:
Start of the period of the date of inspection, in UTC, in the format of either yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'.
If user sends parameter in format yyyy-MM-dd e.g. 2022-12-12 then it is the same as if user sends 2022-12-12T00:00Z
The period between dateTimeFrom and dateTimeTo cannot be more than 31 days.

parameters.name: dateTimeTo
parameters.description:
End of the period of the date of inspection, in UTC, in the format of either yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'.

If user sends parameter in format yyyy-MM-dd e.g. 2023-01-01 then it is the same as if user sends 2023-01-01T23:59Z

Period between dateTimeFrom and dateTimeTo cannot be more than 31 days

parameters.name: groupName
parameters.description: Name of a group. Must be specified if a value for either personName or vehicleName is not specified

parameters.name: personName
parameters.description: Name of the person who submitted the inspection. Must be specified if a value for either vehicleName or groupName is not specified. It supports a list of names.

parameters.name: vehicleName
parameters.description: Friendly name for the vehicle where inspection has been carried out. Must be specified if a value for either personName or groupName is not specified. It supports a list of names.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of inspections to include in the output. If not specified it will default to 200.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: Token returned in a previous call to this endpoint to get the next set of details.

put.description: PUT request to update defect status.

parameters.name: defectId
parameters.description: System-generated unique identifier for the defect.

get.description: GET request to return an image

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: Id of image in string format.

inspectionNumber.description: System generated identifier for the inspection

submittedDateTime.description: Date & time for the fulfilment of inspection, in UTC, in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

inspectionDuration.description: Duration of inspection ISO8601 duration string

personId.description: System identifier of the person submitting the check

personName.description: Name of the driver (person) that completed the check

vehicleId.description: System identifier of the vehicle on which the check was performed

vehicleName.description: Friendly name for the vehicle where the check was performed

groupName.description: Name of the group currently assigned to the vehicle

address.description: Address where the check was performed (shown as the location in the details page)

lng.description: Longitude value for the address where the check was performed

lat.description: Latitude value for the address where the check was performed

checkResult.description: Result of the check. Possible values: PASSED, FAILED, NOT_APPLICABLE, CRITICAL_FAILED

repairStatus.description: Status of the repair. Possible values: OPEN, DEFERRED, CLOSED_REPAIRED, CLOSED_DUPLICATE, CLOSED_NO_FAULT_FOUND, CLOSED

defects.description: Array of defects raised during the vehicle check.

checks.description: Array of checks that have passed.

contactName.description: Name of the person to contact for the inspection.

contactPhone.description: Phone number for the named contact.

odometer.description: The odometer reading submitted from the recording of the check.

completedTooQuickly.description: The Boolean value is set to true when the total check duration is less than the target duration.

statusChanges.description: Changes in repairStatus for the defect during the specified time period.

category.description: Category that the defect was raised under. Custom templates are included.

note.description: Any notes entered by the driver for this defect.

repairStatus.description:
Status of the repair for particular defect:
- OPEN
- DEFERRED
- CLOSED (REPAIRED)
- CLOSED (DUPLICATE)
- CLOSED (NO FAULT FOUND)

photoIds.description: Unique system identifiers for images attached to this vehicle check.

defectId.description: System-generated unique identifier for the defect.

description.description: Text from changing the defectLog associated to a change in repairStatus.

repairDate.description: Date of repair work marked by user.

signature.description: Signature of the person who closed the check.

statusChangeTimestamp.description: The date/time when the status of this defect was last updated.

status.description: The status to which the defect should be updated. Possible options for status: OPEN, DEFERRED, CLOSED_REPAIRED, CLOSED_DUPLICATE, CLOSED_NO_FAULT_FOUND.

signature.description: The signature of the person who modified the status.

repairDate.description: Date of repair in UTC, in the format yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm'Z'.

notes.description: The notes for this status change. Included in the response if notes have been specified for this status change.
